H.text: The morning-after pill prevents pregnancy.
H.ref: If taken within 24 hours, it is 95 percent effective in preventing pregnancy, according to Planned Parenthood.

H.text: The emergency contraceptive is also known as Plan B.
H.ref: But ever since his nomination in February, Crawford has been confronted with questions not only about the safety scandals, but also about the emergency contraceptive, also known as Plan B. The senior Democrat on the Senate Health Education Labor Committee, Sen. Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts, has also raised questions about the morning-after pill.

H.text: The morning-after pill is actually a short series of high-dose birth control pills.
H.ref: But the pill {ndash} actually a short series of high-dose birth control pills {ndash} loses effectiveness with any delay.

H.text: The morning-after pill loses effectiveness with any delay.
H.ref: But the pill {ndash} actually a short series of high-dose birth control pills {ndash} loses effectiveness with any delay.

H.text: The Food and Drug Administration approved the use of the emergency contraception pill in 1998.
H.ref: The Food and Drug Administration approved the use of the emergency contraception pill as a form of prescription birth control in 1998.

H.text: The Food and Drug Administration faced the question of whether an emergency contraceptive could be sold over the counter.
H.ref: President Bush's nominee to lead the Food and Drug Administration is being blocked from Senate confirmation by two Democrats who said Wednesday that they would hold up a vote until the agency settled the long-delayed question of whether an emergency contraceptive could be sold over the counter.

H.text: The Food and Drug Administration had refused to allow over-the-counter sales of Plan B.
H.ref: Senate Democrats on Thursday questioned Dr. Lester M. Crawford, President Bush's choice to lead the Food and Drug Administration, about why the agency had so far refused to allow over-the-counter sales of Plan B, the morning-after pill.

H.text: An order by Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich required pharmacies to dispense birth control and emergency contraceptives without delay.
H.ref: A pharmacist in Illinois has filed a lawsuit challenging an order by Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich requiring pharmacies to dispense birth control and emergency contraceptives without delay.

H.text: A pharmacist in Illinois has filed a lawsuit challenging the order by Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich.
H.ref: A pharmacist in Illinois has filed a lawsuit challenging an order by Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich requiring pharmacies to dispense birth control and emergency contraceptives without delay.

H.text: Some pharmacists around the United States are refusing to fill prescriptions for birth control.
H.ref: Some pharmacists around the country are refusing to fill prescriptions for birth control and morning-after pills, saying that dispensing the medications violates their personal moral or religious beliefs.

H.text: Some pharmacists said that dispensing birth control violates their personal moral or religious beliefs.
H.ref: Some pharmacists around the country are refusing to fill prescriptions for birth control and morning-after pills, saying that dispensing the medications violates their personal moral or religious beliefs.

H.text: Some pharmacists said that dispensing morning-after pills violates their personal moral or religious beliefs.
H.ref: Some pharmacists around the country are refusing to fill prescriptions for birth control and morning-after pills, saying that dispensing the medications violates their personal moral or religious beliefs.

H.text: Pharmacists are regulated by state laws.
H.ref: Pharmacists are regulated by state laws and can face disciplinary action from licensing boards.

H.text: Only one-third of British teens use condoms consistently.
H.ref: Only one-third of British teens use condoms consistently, a health charity said in a report Thursday warning that ignorance about sexual health was putting youth at risk.

H.text: A health charity warned that ignorance about sexual health was putting youth at risk.
H.ref: Only one-third of British teens use condoms consistently, a health charity said in a report Thursday warning that ignorance about sexual health was putting youth at risk.

H.text: President Bush's nominee to lead the Food and Drug Administration is being blocked from Senate confirmation by two Democrats.
H.ref: President Bush's nominee to lead the Food and Drug Administration is being blocked from Senate confirmation by two Democrats who said Wednesday that they would hold up a vote until the agency settled the long-delayed question of whether an emergency contraceptive could be sold over the counter.

H.text: Senate Democrats questioned Dr. Lester M. Crawford about why the agency had so far refused to allow over-the-counter sales of the morning-after pill.
H.ref: Senate Democrats on Thursday questioned Dr. Lester M. Crawford, President Bush's choice to lead the Food and Drug Administration, about why the agency had so far refused to allow over-the-counter sales of Plan B, the morning-after pill.

H.text: Sen. Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts has raised questions about the morning-after pill.
H.ref: But ever since his nomination in February, Crawford has been confronted with questions not only about the safety scandals, but also about the emergency contraceptive, also known as Plan B. The senior Democrat on the Senate Health Education Labor Committee, Sen. Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts, has also raised questions about the morning-after pill.

H.text: Vander Bleek said he conscientiously objected to the order of Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich.
H.ref: Vander Bleek said he conscientiously objected to the order, which was issued in April after two women reported that a drugstore in Chicago would not fill their prescriptions for morning-after pills.

H.text: Two women reported that a drugstore in Chicago would not fill their prescriptions for morning-after pills.
H.ref: Vander Bleek said he conscientiously objected to the order, which was issued in April after two women reported that a drugstore in Chicago would not fill their prescriptions for morning-after pills.

H.text: The morning-after pill must be taken within 72 hours after sexual intercourse.
H.ref: Women's advocates say such policies are impractical, especially late at night in emergency situations involving the morning-after pill, which must be taken within 72 hours.

H.text: The morning-after pill prevents pregnancies by interfering with ovulation.
H.ref: Plan B prevents 89 percent of pregnancies when it is taken within 72 hours of intercourse, either by interfering with ovulation or by blocking fertilization.

H.text: The morning-after pill prevents pregnancies by blocking fertilization.
H.ref: Plan B prevents 89 percent of pregnancies when it is taken within 72 hours of intercourse, either by interfering with ovulation or by blocking fertilization.

H.text: Plan B is manufactured by Barr Laboratories.
H.ref: Plan B, manufactured by Barr Laboratories, was approved for use by prescription in June 1999.

H.text: There is a proposal which would limit the pillâ€™s sale over the counter to women over 16.
H.ref: Another proposal, which would limit its sale to women over 16, has also been pending.

H.text: The proposal to make emergency contraception available over the counter was endorsed by the FDA's own experts.
H.ref: Access would be much better if the Food and Drug Administration accepted a proposal {ndash} endorsed by the FDA's own experts {ndash} to make emergency contraception available over the counter.
